ReflectionQuestions: What did you do? Describe the activity. (Answer the questions Who? What? Where? When?)
Describe an essential employability skill that you have developed as a result of attending this event.
How does this help you as a job seeker? (I met a new contact. I added something to my résumé. I learned a new skill that will make me a better employee.)

PassportItems.Title: Express yourself professionally
PassportItems.Description: Start a portfolio on ePortfolio, create a WordPress blog, or set up and run a new social media account dedicated to your professional life.

PassportItems.Title: Seek out career advice
PassportItems.Description: Seek one-on-one career advising by contacting a thought-leader or attending a Career Hub event and following up with your mentor or event attendees afterwards to thank them for their time.

PassportItems.Title: Build your professional network off-campus
PassportItems.Description: Develop a business card and have this printed for you, the meet new people at an organized off-campus networking event or activity and follow up afterwards with the people you met.

PassportItems.Title: Explore your community
PassportItems.Description: Attend a community festival, organized event, or concert and document your attendance with photos and social media posts.

PassportItems.Title: Gather information about your industry
PassportItems.Description: Attend an informative co-curricular workshop, lab, lecture or talk to build your knowledge of your occupation, industry or sector.

PassportItems.Title: Join a club or team on campus
PassportItems.Description: Join a club or team based on your interests or values and document your participation with photos and social media posts.

PassportItems.Title: Volunteer on campus
PassportItems.Description: Attend a community festival, organized event, or concert and document your attendance with photos and social media posts.

PassportItems.Title: Engage your industry
PassportItems.Description: Attend a job fair, trade show, open house, or employer tour to make contacts and learn specific information about your industry.

PassportItems.Title: Develop a New Technical Skill
PassportItems.Description: Complete an online course or 'microdegree' to become a more qualified job seeker.

PassportItems.Title: Perfect your communication
PassportItems.Description: Join the conversation circles, English language partners, join a seminar or classes to learn a new language, or participate in off-campus groups.

PassportItems.Title: Expand your industry contacts
PassportItems.Description: Extend your professional network by conducting an informational interview.

Links.Text: Questions to Ask at the Informational Interview

PassportItems.Title: Become a Mentor
PassportItems.Description: Help others through mentoring, tutoring, teaching, coaching, or refereeing.

PassportItems.Title: Showcase your technical mastery
PassportItems.Description: Apply your technical or industry knowledge at a Hackathon competition, industy project, or freelance opportunity. Document your participation and add this to a professional portfolio.

PassportItems.Title: Lead in your community
PassportItems.Description: Join a committee or board of a cultural, community or campus organization in a leadership position. Add this leadership role to your LinkedIn account.

PassportItems.Title: Volunteer off-campus
PassportItems.Description: Give back to your communicaty by volunteering for a charity, organization or cause that is important to you.

PassportItems.Title: Hardcore Traveller: Start a business
PassportItems.Description: Promote your entrepreneurial spirit by preparing a business plan, completeing the E@C modules, or applying for a business grant or license.
